hanzi-su-wiki:
各

Значения

Каждый, все

Мнемоника

Обособлять 夂 свой рот 口. Уходить из дому и жить самостоятельно. Это вправе сделать каждый член семьи.

purpleculture_examples:
各种 [ gè zhǒng ]: every kind of; all kinds of; various kinds
各地 [ gè dì ]: in all parts of (a country); various regions
各国 [ gè guó ]: each country; every country; various countries
各个 [ gè gè ]: every; various; separately, one by one
各自 [ gè zì ]: each; respective; apiece
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 夂 [ zhǐ ] to go
    • 口 [ kǒu ] mouth; entrance, gate, opening
heisig_chinese_memo: Each person is gifted with a mouth to get us into trouble and a pair of walking legs to get us out!
heisig_story: "Suum cuique" goes the popular Latin proverb. A certain disease of the English language makes it almost impossible to translate the phrase without gender bias. In any event, here we see someone walking with his/her mouth between his/her walking legs, giving us an image of "To each his/her own."

koohiiStory1: Son, I´ve never told you this but each woman has a second mouth between their fiiiiiine walking legs.
koohiiStory2: Each and every one of us walks and talks differently.
jp_example_words:
各種(かくしゅ): every kind, all sorts
各々(それぞれ): each, every, either, respectively, severally
各々(おのおの): each, every, either, respectively, severally
各自(かくじ): individual, each

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You kiss each of your best pals to show them how much you love and care for them. You kiss each friend right on the mouth.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine kissing each of your best friends on the mouth. Does this make you uncomfortable? Excited? Both? Feel that feeling.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Actually, each of your best pals are of the cock (かく) variety. By that, I mean they are both roosters. Imagine kissing both of these cocks on their beaks.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Kissing the cock beak is kind of a strange experience. Feel the feathers in your hands as you steady the cock to kiss it. Cock-a-doodle-doo!

humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The word " each " in oracle bone inscriptions is from "凵" (or "口") from "夊" (like a foot with toes down), and inscriptions from "口" from "夊". The word "凵" or " mouth " is like a cave. The ancients lived in caves. The word " each " has its feet facing the cave, which means that people come and enter the cave, which is the opposite of " out ". " Each " is the first text of " 𢓜 ", the original meaning is to come. "dialect. One": "𢓜, to also." "Dialect. Two" "𢓜, come also." (Qiu Xigui) Jia Jinwen or from the side of "彳", which means that it is beside the road. Those from the outside to the visiting home are called " Ke ", see " Ke ".

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning of coming, and the inscription "every rain" means rain comes, and "every cloud" means clouds come. "Collection" 33348: "The water is different." "Collection" 24756: "There will be rain today." "Collection" 21022: "Every cloud is not rain."

The inscription also said that he came, and the pot: "The king is in the palace", which means that the king came to the palace.㝬Zhong: "Use 卲 each not (pi) to show and (ancestor) test, the ancestor." "卲 Ge" means "recruit each", which means to invite the souls of the ancestors and kings (Guo Moruo). The "Sage" literature is used as "Zhao Jia ", " False " is a false loan word for " Concubine ", "Shu Wen": "Concubine, Zhi Ye." "Poetry. Lu Song. Pan Water ":" Yunwenyunwu, Zhao false Liezu. "Inscriptions came to represent the" each "again the sounds of" guest "," Los "means.

The meaning of " each " and " 𢓜 " and "enter" in ancient books are often expressed by "格" and "徦". "Er Ya. "Explanation": "Ge, Zhiye." and "Explanation": "Ge, come also." "Book. "Shun Dian": "The Emperor Says: Ge Rushun", Kong Anguo Biography: "Ge, come." "Yi Li. "Shi Guan Li": "When you are a filial friend, you are always guaranteed." Zheng Xuan's note: "The standard is the most important." "Yue Ling": "(Meng Xia) executes the spring order, then the locusts will be the disaster, and the storm will come to the grid." Zheng Xuan's note: "The grid is the ultimate." "Yi. Family": "Wang Jia has a home." "Poetry. Shang Song. "Xuanniao": "Fake from all over the world, and fake Qiqi." Zheng Xuanjian: "Fake, it's true."

After " each " is often used as a demonstrative pronoun, that is, "each" of " each " and "each person". The Bamboo Slips of the Warring States Period and the Silk Script of the Han Dynasty express their respective, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. "Yu Shu" Jian 1: "The ancients, people have their own local customs." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Jian. "The Way of the Officials" Jane 35: "Everyone eats what he has (has addiction)". "Mawangdui. Line 232 of the Second Edition of Lao Zi: "Each return to its roots, and say quiet."

"Shuowen": "Each, different words. From the mouth, the 夂. The 夂 person, there is a line to stop, not to listen to each other."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The oracle " each " elephant feet face the cave, indicating that people come and enter the cave. The original meaning is arrival, which is the opposite of " out ".
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文的「各」字從「凵」（或「口」）從「夊」(象腳趾向下的腳)，金文則從「口」從「夊」。「凵」或「口」象洞穴，古人穴居，「各」字象腳朝向洞穴，表示人來到和進入洞穴，與「出」的意思相反。「各」是「𢓜」的初文，本義是來到。《方言．一》：「𢓜，至也。」《方言．二》「𢓜，來也。」(裘錫圭) 甲金文或從「彳」旁，表示在道路的旁邊。由外而至到訪家中的稱為「客」，參見「客」。

　　甲骨文用作本義，表示來到，卜辭「各雨」即雨水到來，「各雲」即雲朵飄來。《合集》33348：「大水不各」。《合集》24756：「今日有各雨」。《合集》21022：「各云不其雨」。

　　金文也表示來到，曶壺：「王各于成宮」，表示王來到成宮。㝬鐘：「用卲各不(丕)顯且(祖)考、先王。」「卲各」即「招各」，表示招請先公先王的靈魂到來(郭沫若)。「卲各」文獻作「昭假」，「假」是「徦」的假借字，《說文》：「徦，至也。」《詩．魯頌．泮水》：「允文允武，昭假烈祖。」金文表示來到的「各」又以音近的「客」、「洛」表示。

　　「各」、「𢓜」字「進入」之義古書多借「格」、「徦」字表示。《爾雅．釋詁》：「格，至也。」又《釋言》：「格，來也。」《書．舜典》：「帝曰：格汝舜」，孔安國傳：「格，來。」《儀禮．士冠禮》：「孝友時格，永乃保之。」鄭玄注：「格，至也。」《禮記．月令》：「(孟夏)行春令，則蝗蟲為災，暴風來格。」鄭玄注：「格，至也。」《易．家人》：「王假有家。」《詩．商頌．玄鳥》：「四海來假，來假祁祁。」鄭玄箋：「假，至也。」

　　「各」後多被借用作指示代詞，即「各自」、「各人」的「各」。戰國竹簡和漢帛書表示各自，《睡虎地秦簡．語書》簡1：「古者，民各有鄉俗。」《睡虎地秦簡．為吏之道》簡35：「人各食其所耆(嗜)」。《馬王堆．老子乙本》第232行：「各復歸於其根，曰靜。」

　　《說文》：「各，異辭也。从口，夂。夂者，有行而止之，不相聽也。」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文「各」象腳朝向洞穴，表示人來到和進入洞穴，本義是到來，與「出」相反。

Heisig constituents: each, walking legs, mouth
Heisig: "Suum cuique" goes the popular Latin proverb. A certain disease of the English language makes it almost impossible to translate the phrase without gender bias. In any event, here we see someone walking with his/her mouth between his/her walking legs, giving us an image of "To each his/her own."
* The sense of the proverb should help when using this kanji as a primitive; otherwise, reduce it to its original elements. But do not associate it in any way with the word "every," which we shall meet later in another context.

甲骨文的「 各 」字從「 凵 」（或「 口 」）從「 夊 」(象腳趾向下的腳)，金文則從「 口 」從「 夊 」。「 凵 」或「 口 」象洞穴，古人穴居，「 各 」字象腳朝向洞穴，表示人來到和進入洞穴，與「 出 」的意思相反。「 各 」是「 𢓜 」的初文，本義是來到。《方言．一》：「𢓜，至也。」《方言．二》「𢓜，來也。」(裘錫圭) 甲金文或從「 彳 」旁，表示在道路的旁邊。由外而至到訪家中的稱為「 客 」，參見「 客 」。 甲骨文用作本義，表示來到，卜辭「各雨」即雨水到來，「各雲」即雲朵飄來。《合集》33348：「大水不各」。《合集》24756：「今日有各雨」。《合集》21022：「各云不其雨」。 金文也表示來到，曶壺：「王各于成宮」，表示王來到成宮。㝬鐘：「用卲各不(丕)顯且(祖)考、先王。」「卲各」即「招各」，表示招請先公先王的靈魂到來(郭沫若)。「卲各」文獻作「昭假」，「 假 」是「 徦 」的假借字，《說文》：「徦，至也。」《詩．魯頌．泮水》：「允文允武，昭假烈祖。」金文表示來到的「 各 」又以音近的「 客 」、「 洛 」表示。 「 各 」、「 𢓜 」字「進入」之義古書多借「 格 」、「 徦 」字表示。《爾雅．釋詁》：「格，至也。」又《釋言》：「格，來也。」《書．舜典》：「帝曰：格汝舜」，孔安國傳：「格，來。」《儀禮．士冠禮》：「孝友時格，永乃保之。」鄭玄注：「格，至也。」《禮記．月令》：「(孟夏)行春令，則蝗蟲為災，暴風來格。」鄭玄注：「格，至也。」《易．家人》：「王假有家。」《詩．商頌．玄鳥》：「四海來假，來假祁祁。」鄭玄箋：「假，至也。」 「 各 」後多被借用作指示代詞，即「各自」、「各人」的「 各 」。戰國竹簡和漢帛書表示各自，《睡虎地秦簡．語書》簡1：「古者，民各有鄉俗。」《睡虎地秦簡．為吏之道》簡35：「人各食其所耆(嗜)」。《馬王堆．老子乙本》第232行：「各復歸於其根，曰靜。」 《說文》：「各，異辭也。从口，夂。夂者，有行而止之，不相聽也。」

各字的基本解释

各
gè
每个，彼此不同：各别。各得其所。各尽所能。各有千秋。各自为政。

各
gě
〔自各儿（
方言，特别：这个人真各。g噐 ）〕自己，亦作“自个儿”。

各字的汉语字典释义
各字的康熙字典解释
各字的源字形
各字的起名意思

：特别、与众不同。各得其所、各尽所能、各有千秋，形容独一无二。

each
Basic explanation of words
each
gè
Each is different from each other: each. Each has its place. Each does his best. Each has its own merits. Separate things.
each
gě
〔From each one (
Dialect, special: This person is really different. g 噐)] self, also referred to as "self".
each
Chinese dictionary definition of words
each
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
each
Source glyph
each
Name meaning
: Special and different. Each has its own merits, each does its best, and each has its own merits, which is unique in description.
gè, gě
1) каждый, всякий (в различных падежах и с разными предлогами); с отрицанием ни один, никто
各一 каждого (предмета) по одному; с каждого по одному
各二 каждого (предмета) по два; с каждого по два
各无异言 ни у кого не нашлось иного мнения (возражения)

这人很各，不跟人来往 этот человек особенный, не общается с людьми
Radicals: 各  (kiss)
Meaning Mnemonic
You kiss each of your best pals to show them how much you love and care for them. You kiss each friend right on the mouth.
Imagine kissing each of your best friends on the mouth. Does this make you uncomfortable? Excited? Both? Feel that feeling.
Reading Mnemonic
Actually, each of your best pals are of the cock (かく) variety. By that, I mean they are both roosters. Imagine kissing both of these cocks on their beaks.
Kissing the cock beak is kind of a strange experience. Feel the feathers in your hands as you steady the cock to kiss it. Cock-a-doodle-doo!
